intro: Hippocrepis comosa var. burgalensis, commonly known as the Burgalensis harebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its typical legume structure. The plant produces delicate blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture and conservation efforts.
